topic.title: HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade 2.0: Verifying the LDAP Deployment

bodydiv.p: After installing HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade, you can use the following commands to verify that LDAP is functioning correctly.

ol.li:
Log into any of the controllers.
sudo su -

Source the stackrcv3 file:
source stackrcv3

List the current Keystone users:
keystone user-list

List the current users in the domain you want to test. Make note of the user_id of the user you want to test with
openstack user list --domain <domain_name>

Create new project and make note of its ID:
openstack project create --domain <domain_name> <project_name>

Grant the user administrative permsission to the project you created.
openstack role add --user <user name> --project <tenant id> admin

List the current domains and make note of the domain_id for domain you are testing in:
openstack domain list

Copy the stackrcv3 to new a file. For example:
cp stackrcv3 stackrcv3_new
Edit the new file with details of the user you want to use and the project you want to use

Exit the session to clear environmental variables:
exit

Log back into the controller.
sudo su -

Source newly created stackrcv3 file. For example:
source stackrcv3_new

Test the Keystone service:
openstack user list --domain <domain_name> keystone user-list

Test the Neutron service:
openstack network list neutron net-list

Test the Nova service:
nova list

Test the Glance service:
openstack image list glance image-list

Test the Cinder service:
openstack volume list

Test the Swift service:
openstack container list swift list

Test the Heat service:
heat stack-list

Test the Ceilometer service:
ceilometer event-list

bodydiv.p: If all these test pass to your satisfaction, the HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade installation is complete. To learn more information about using HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade, see the Administrator Guide.
